Articles.Content: Well... after reading https://what-if.xkcd.com/35/ What if 35 on the xkcd website I became amazed by Operation plumbob (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plumbbob#Propulsion_of_steel_plate_cap) and want to recreate potato canon style! I will use a penny as the manhole cover and a pvc pipe as the tunnel. So... any recommendations as fuel or pvc thickness or anything else?
Two things come to my mind: pipe bomb and Darwin award.
I'm planning on doing this in the middle of a large field near my house where I've set off many a potato canon before so it should be safe.
What will be the fuel that launches this thing?
Possibly hairspray like a potato canon.
Oh, then you're fine. I thought you're going to use gunpowder.
I love the kid and the comments!

Spaceman, be sure to get yourself a hard hat. A 10-20 dollar hard hat is much cheaper than a 500+ dollar hospital bill.

http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss_1?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=3M%20Hard%20Hat

It'd be a shame to see a 15 year-old going to the hospital over a penny fired from a potato gun. Then again, you could become the laughing stock of the neighbourhood.
What's the hard hat for? If he needs protection, it's a face shield...

What's the hard hat for? If he needs protection, it's a face shield...

There's a penny flying up. Unless it has enough velocity to escape the earth's gravity or reaches orbit, it must come back down. If there isn't any wind or it doesn't get high enough to reach the jetstream in the upper atmosphere, he could get konked in the head with the penny. Thus, hard hat. Although, a face shield could come in handy if he doesn't know what he's doing.
